title: System established; name
context: §88-22 System established; name. There shall be a retirement system for the purpose of providing retirement allowances and other benefits for employees. It shall have the powers and privileges of a corporation and shall be known as the &ldquo;Employees&rsquo; Retirement System of the State of Hawaii&rdquo; and by that name may sue or be sued, transact all of its business, invest all of its funds, and hold all of its cash and securities and other property. [L 1925, c 55, §2; am imp L 1927, c 251, §§1, 2, 5; RL 1935, §7921; am L 1935, c 48, §3; RL 1945, §702; RL 1955, §6-21; HRS §88-22; am L 1969, c 110, pt of §1] Case Notes Where no showing that board&rsquo;s failure to authorize and pursue appeal would precipitate crisis in system&rsquo;s operations or jeopardize system&rsquo;s corporate existence, system&rsquo;s purported administrator could not initiate appeal on system&rsquo;s behalf under exception to general rule that only corporation&rsquo;s board possesses authority to control corporation&rsquo;s litigation. 87 H. 152, 952 P.2d 1215. Mentioned: 74 H. 181, 840 P.2d 367.
